the only switch available is cherry MX
red and that's a pretty safe starting

the overall build quality for 50 bucks
I wasn't expecting much but this thing
just feels robust there's an aluminum

plastic to aluminum transition on the
white model but otherwise became 360 is
pretty impressive but there are some
small issues that I want to mention
quickly - first of all the material
joints are well done but I found the
left right and bottom edges really sharp
also when the keyboard is in its lowest
position it slides all over the place
since there's only two rubber feet and
the lower edge luckily the height
adjusting feet high rubber on them so
it's only an issue when the km 360 is at

the included quartz braiding tends to
king two especially when you're wrapping
